body_html:
Yes, latest pip solves the first part. But the libc.so is bigger problem. It is non trivial hacks to give the one app newer glibc than the system one.

You may try recompile it on your system. But it may take some effort just to compile bazel, you will not have java8, nor newer versions of numpy nor anything else... Is upgrading to at least 14.04 LTS realy not an option for you?

body:
Yes, latest pip solves the first part. But the libc.so is bigger problem. It is non trivial hacks to give the one app newer glibc than the system one.

You may try recompile it on your system. But it may take some effort just to compile bazel, you will not have java8, nor newer versions of numpy nor anything else... Is upgrading to at least 14.04 LTS realy not an option for you?
